analyzed: kaṇḍarījātaka  nara anama ārāma karāsu nārisu

translated: Women are the delight of men, but they are fickle-minded and hard to control.

analyzed: sabbattha na api iti karā api ce siyā
translated: Even if you are the one who brings them pleasure,

analyzed: na vissase tittha samāḥ hi nāriyaḥ
translated: you should not trust them, for women are like fords.
“When a man sees a Kaṇḍarī Kinnara,
all women take no pleasure in their homes.
Having abandoned such a man, his wife
sees another man and is bitten by a snake.”

analyzed: bakassa ca bāvarikassa raññaḥ  accanta kāma anugatassa bhariyā
translated: “The wife of the crane king Bāvarika,
who was devoted to his wife,🔽cheated on him, who was devoted to her.

original: Kaṁ vāpi itthī nāticare tadaññaṁ”.🔽“Piṅgiyānī sabbalokissarassa,
analyzed: kam vā api itthī na aticare  piṅgiyānī sabba lokissarassa
translated: What woman would not cheat on another?”🔽“Piṅgiyā, the wife of King Brahmadatta,
who was dear to the king, the lord of all the world,
cheated on him, who was devoted to her.

analyzed: tam vā api sā na ajjhagā kāma kāminī iti
translated: She did not stop, even though she was in love with him.”
